title: 2 Quick Ways to Always Display Bookmarks in Chrome

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . You'll see the three-dot menu in the top-right corner of the Google Chrome browser window. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Hover over "Bookmarks and lists" and select Show bookmarks bar.
steps.content: Hover over "Bookmarks and lists" and select Show bookmarks bar . This will open the bookmarks bar. [1] X Research source You can also use the keyboard shortcut: CTRL + Shift + B (Windows) or CMD + Shift + B (Mac). If you want to hide the bookmarks bar, right-click the bookmarks bar and click Show bookmarks bar to uncheck it.

steps.title: Open the Google Chrome app.
steps.content: Open the Google Chrome app. This looks like a multi-colored sphere with a blue center. Google Chrome is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . There is no bookmarks bar in the mobile app, but you can still access all of your bookmarks.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . On Android, this will be in the top-right corner. On iOS, this will be in the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Bookmarks.
steps.content: Tap Bookmarks . This is next to the star icon. You may need to swipe left on the top icons to find it. If you have sync enabled , you'll also see your desktop bookmarks here. If you don't see it and it's enabled, make sure you're logged into the correct Google account .
